| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 1533](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L1533) |

A **elder pseudodragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous"), [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")-like [domestic animal](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal") that is a stronger form of the [pseudodragon](/wiki/Pseudodragon "Pseudodragon").

An elder pseudodragon has a bite attack and a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") sting, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") an elder pseudodragon [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") confers the [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster") intrinsic unless the character is an [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") or [Caveperson](/wiki/Caveperson "Caveperson"), similar to [kittens](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") and [little dogs](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") and their growth stages.

## Generation

Elder pseudodragons are not generated randomly, though they are a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"). A pseudodragon can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into an elder pseudodragon, and an elder pseudodragon can grow up into an [ancient pseudodragon](/wiki/Ancient_pseudodragon "Ancient pseudodragon").

Elder pseudodragons can be generated via the [spell of create familiar](/wiki/Spell_of_create_familiar "Spell of create familiar").

## Encyclopedia entry

In the West the dragon was the natural enemy of man. Although  
preferring to live in bleak and desolate regions, whenever it  
was seen among men it left in its wake a trail of destruction  
and disease. Yet any attempt to slay this beast was a perilous  
undertaking. For the dragon's assailant had to contend  
not only with clouds of sulphurous fumes pouring from its fire  
breathing nostrils, but also with the thrashings of its tail,  
the most deadly part of its serpent-like body.  
\[ Mythical Beasts by Deirdre Headon (The Leprechaun Library) ]  
  
"One whom the dragons will speak with," he said, "that is a  
dragonlord, or at least that is the center of the matter. It's  
not a trick of mastering the dragons, as most people think.  
Dragons have no masters. The question is always the same, with  
a dragon: will he talk to you or will he eat you? If you can  
count upon his doing the former, and not doing the latter, why  
then you're a dragonlord."  
\[ The Tombs of Atuan, by Ursula K. Le Guin ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Elder_pseudodragon\&action=edit)*

html:
Elder pseudodragon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D elder pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks Bite 1d6, Sting 1d4 poison
D elder pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Bite 1d6, Sting 1d4 poison

Base level 4
Base experience 36
Speed 18
Base AC 2
Base MR 40
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 300
Nutritional value 200
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed None

A elder pseudodragon:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 1533

A elder pseudodragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a carnivorous, dragon-like domestic animal that is a stronger form of the pseudodragon.

An elder pseudodragon has a bite attack and a poisonous sting, and possesses poison resistance.

Eating an elder pseudodragon corpse or tin confers the aggravate monster intrinsic unless the character is an orc or Caveperson, similar to kittens and little dogs and their growth stages.

Generation

Elder pseudodragons are not generated randomly, though they are a valid form for normal polymorph. A pseudodragon can grow up into an elder pseudodragon, and an elder pseudodragon can grow up into an ancient pseudodragon.

Elder pseudodragons can be generated via the spell of create familiar.

Encyclopedia entry

In the West the dragon was the natural enemy of man. Although
preferring to live in bleak and desolate regions, whenever it
was seen among men it left in its wake a trail of destruction
and disease. Yet any attempt to slay this beast was a perilous
undertaking. For the dragon's assailant had to contend
not only with clouds of sulphurous fumes pouring from its fire
breathing nostrils, but also with the thrashings of its tail,
the most deadly part of its serpent-like body.
[ Mythical Beasts by Deirdre Headon (The Leprechaun Library) ]

"One whom the dragons will speak with," he said, "that is a
dragonlord, or at least that is the center of the matter. It's
not a trick of mastering the dragons, as most people think.
Dragons have no masters. The question is always the same, with
a dragon: will he talk to you or will he eat you? If you can
count upon his doing the former, and not doing the latter, why
then you're a dragonlord."
[ The Tombs of Atuan, by Ursula K. Le Guin ]

A '''elder pseudodragon''', {{brown|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[carnivorous]], [[dragon]]-like [[domestic animal]] that is a stronger form of the [[pseudodragon]].

An elder pseudodragon has a bite attack and a [[poisonous]] sting, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

[[Eating]] an elder pseudodragon [[corpse]] or [[tin]] confers the [[aggravate monster]] intrinsic unless the character is an [[Orc (starting race)|orc]] or [[Caveperson]], similar to [[kitten]]s and [[little dog]]s and their growth stages.

==Generation==
Elder pseudodragons are not generated randomly, though they are a valid form for normal [[polymorph]]. A pseudodragon can [[grow up]] into an elder pseudodragon, and an elder pseudodragon can grow up into an [[ancient pseudodragon]].

Elder pseudodragons can be generated via the [[spell of create familiar]].
